snippet: Live music can reduce stress and stabilize vital signs in premature babies, letting them devote more energy to normal development, said a study on music in medicine.
abstract: Study conducted in 11 hospitals, published in journal Pediatrics, finds that live music can be beneficial to premature babies; researchers conclude that live music, either played or sung, can help infants sleep and eat and calm their heart and breathing rates, letting them devote more energy to normal development.
lead_paragraph: Live music can reduce stress and stabilize vital signs in premature babies, letting them devote more energy to normal development, said a study on music in medicine.

headline.seo: Live Music Soothes Premature Babies, a New Study Finds
headline.main: Live Music’s Charms, Soothing Premature Hearts
headline.print_headline: Live Music’s Charms, Soothing Premature Hearts
